meanings.definition: To conceal in or as if in the palm of the hand.
meanings.sent1: She palmed the small key to keep it hidden.
meanings.sent2: He palmed the coin before showing it to the audience.
meanings.sent3: The magician palmed the rabbit, making it disappear in an instant.
meanings.sent4: The spy palmed the microfilm, slipping it past security undetected.
meanings.sent5: The pickpocket palmed the wallet skillfully, leaving the victim unaware.

meanings.definition: To touch or handle with the palm of the hand.
meanings.sent1: He palmed the smooth stone, feeling its coolness.
meanings.sent2: She palmed the fabric to check its texture.
meanings.sent3: The toddler palmed the puppy gently, giggling at its soft fur.
meanings.sent4: The gardener palmed the soil, assessing its moisture content.
meanings.sent5: The artist palmed the brush, ready to create a masterpiece.
